com.codepotato.controller

Class AudioController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codepotato.controller.AudioController

  • public class AudioController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller class, used as the centerpiece for view to use Contains a Player and an EffectChain, instantiated
    Author:
    David Hua on 4/16/2014.

      AudioController(java.io.File filename)
      AudioController: creates new instance of Player and EffectChain

      • addEffect

        public int addEffect(Effect eff)
        Calls on EffectChain's addEffect (which adds an effect to list of Effects in EffectChain)
        Parameters:
        eff - Effect to be added

      • getEffect

        public Effect getEffect(int id)
        Calls on EffectChain's getEffect (which gets an effect from list of Effects in EffectChain)
        Parameters:
        id - Effect's ID, used to identify the Effect being requested from the list of effects
        Returns:
        Effect being searched

      • removeEffect

        public boolean removeEffect(int effID)
        Calls on EffectChain's removeEffect (which removes an effect from list of Effects in EffectChain)
        Parameters:
        effID - Effect's ID, used to identify the Effect being removed from the list of effects
        Returns:
        boolean Checking if Effect was found in EffectChain, and removed (null if not found)

      • play

        public void play()
        Calls on audioPlayer's play (which creates and runs new thread for playback)

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Calls on audioPlayer's pause (which kill playback thread)

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Calls on audioPlayer's isPlaying (which checks if Player is playing or paused
        Returns:
        boolean to check if player is playing or paused

      • seekPlayer

        public void seekPlayer(int location)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        location - Called from audioPlayer's seek() Given a location between 0 and 100 %, seek() will move playback to the appropriate position in the audio file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • returnPlayerToBeginning

        public void returnPlayerToBeginning()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Calls on audioPlayer's seekToBeginning() A convenient method that returns the playback to the beginning.
        Throws:

      • audioLength

        public int audioLength()
        Returns:
        length of current audio track, in seconds

      • currAudioPosition

        public int currAudioPosition()
        Returns:
        current position of playback in percent from 0-100
